channel.title: BBC News - Home
channel.description: The latest stories from the Home section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Lifestyle quiz to secure a mortgage
item.description: Mortgage applicants will face tougher questions about their lifestyle from lenders, under new rules about to come into force.

item.title: Russia 'destabilising' Ukraine - US
item.description: The US accuses Russia of "deception and destabilisation" in eastern Ukraine, warning of further sanctions unless Moscow defuses the crisis.

item.title: UK science to get £200m polar ship
item.description: UK scientists are to get a £200m icebreaker, which will be one of the biggest, most capable polar research vessels in the world.

item.title: Miliband plans zero-hours crackdown
item.description: Ed Miliband will unveil plans to tackle the "epidemic" of zero-hours contracts in a speech in Scotland later.

item.title: Probe over Hillsborough insult posts
item.description: The government says it is making "urgent inquiries" into reports Whitehall computers were used to make insulting comments about the Hillsborough disaster.

item.title: MPs urge action on foreign prisoners
item.description: Foreign prisoners are not being deported quickly enough to help cut costs and relieve overcrowding in jails, MPs warn.

item.title: Obama in S Korea amid nuclear fears
item.description: US President Barack Obama arrives in Seoul for a visit that comes amid concern North Korea may be planning a fourth nuclear test.

item.title: New hearing for Briton in US prison
item.description: A US judge orders a hearing to consider new evidence relating to the 1987 double-murder conviction of a British businessman in Miami.

item.title: Tech giants settle hiring court case
item.description: Technology giants Apple, Google, Intel and Adobe settle a class action lawsuit alleging they conspired to hold down salaries.

item.title: Terrorism financing suspect arrested
item.description: Officers from the Metropolitan Police arrest a man in London on suspicion of financing and encouragement of terrorism.

item.title: Health atlas shows risks by area
item.description: A new online map of England and Wales allows people to enter their postcode and find their community's level of risk of developing 14 conditions, such as heart disease and lung cancer.

item.title: William and Kate at Anzac Day events
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge pay their respects to Australia's war dead on the final day of their tour.

item.title: Coalition's Church 'split' - front pages
item.description: Claims that the coalition is split over the role of the Church of England and interviews given by the girlfriend of the Duchess of Cornwall's late brother make headlines.

item.title: MPs' 'localness' level measured
item.description: Almost two-thirds of MPs are "local" to the area they represent, research suggests.

item.title: Girl gives father's CV to Mrs Obama
item.description: A young girl offered US First Lady Michelle Obama her father's CV during questions at the White House's Take Our Daughters and Sons to Work Day.

item.title: Ramires to miss rest of league season
item.description: Chelsea midfielder Ramires accepts the Football Association's charge of violent conduct for fracas in defeat to Sunderland.

item.title: Champion O'Sullivan trails Perry
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan trails Joe Perry 5-3 after the first session of their second-round match at the World Snooker Championship.

item.title: Klopp rules out Man Utd switch
item.description: Borussia Dortmund boss Jurgen Klopp rules himself out of contention to become the next manager of Manchester United.

item.title: Rangers great Jardine dies aged 65
item.description: Former Rangers, Hearts and Scotland defender Sandy Jardine dies aged 65 following a battle with cancer.

item.title: Home nations in Euro 2020 scrap - SFA
item.description: Scotland will need to beat their closest neighbours if Glasgow is to be a Euro 2020 host city, says SFA chief Stewart Regan.

item.title: Barclays wins pay package vote
item.description: Barclays shareholders vote to approve the bank's remuneration package, which includes higher bonuses despite a 30% fall in profits.

item.title: VIDEO: Take a tour of a million-dollar car
item.description: Since the age of five, Christian von Koenigsegg knew he wanted to create the world's fastest car. On the floor of the New York International Auto Show, he tells the BBC how he did it.

item.title: UKIP bans 'racist views' candidate
item.description: UKIP suspends a council candidate featured in its latest election broadcast for expressing "repellent" views on Twitter.

item.title: VIDEO: How will the European electorate vote?
item.description: Campaigns have started for Europe's elections in just over a month but is the European electorate engaged?

item.title: Human skin grown in laboratory
item.description: Skin grown in the laboratory could replace animals in drug and cosmetics testing, according to UK scientists.

item.title: AUDIO: The effects of Spinal Muscular Atrophy
item.description: Kelly Fletcher explains the serious genetic condition Spinal Muscular Atrophy.

item.title: Tuition-fee change savings 'unclear'
item.description: A study says the public cost of higher university fees and loans is "highly uncertain" and depends on how much future graduates will earn.

item.title: VIDEO: Education warnings 'six years ago'
item.description: Concerns raised earlier this month about a lack of long-term vision for education in Wales were highlighted over six years ago according to a confidential document.

item.title: Warhol works found on Amiga disks
item.description: A dozen previously unknown works created by Andy Warhol have been recovered from 30-year-old Amiga disks.

item.title: VIDEO: Did Pixar make Steve Jobs funny?
item.description: Ed Catmull, President of Pixar, explains how Steve Jobs use of humour in presentations was influenced by his time at the animation firm.

item.title: Mystery of dazzling supernova solved
item.description: An exceptionally bright supernova that baffled scientists has been explained - its light is amplified by another galaxy acting as a "lens".

item.title: VIDEO: Film features plight of African park
item.description: The lethal realities of life in Virunga National Park are the subject of a British documentary which has just had its world premiere at the Tribeca Film Festival in New York.

item.title: Pet Shop Boys premiere at BBC Proms
item.description: An orchestral work by the Pet Shop Boys about the life of wartime codebreaker Alan Turing is to have its world premiere at this year's BBC Proms.

item.title: VIDEO: Banksy street art on show in hotel
item.description: Street murals by graffiti artist Banksy - many of them cut off the sides of buildings - have been put on show at an exhibition in London before they are auctioned off.

item.title: Caption Challenge: Flower power
item.description: It's the Caption Challenge. Oh yes it is.

item.title: Are gardeners wrong to put 'crocks' in plant pots?
item.description: For centuries, gardeners have put shards of pottery - "crocks" - at the bottom of plant pots. Why?

item.title: Mother charged with three murders
item.description: A mother is charged with murdering three of her children who were found dead at their home in south-west London.

item.title: Cancer fundraiser achieves £2m
item.description: A teenager with terminal cancer raises more than £2m for charity.

item.title: Life of Margo MacDonald celebrated
item.description: Hundreds of people are gathering to celebrate the life of veteran politician Margo MacDonald, following her death earlier this month at the age of 70.

item.title: Miliband in Scotland to make UK case
item.description: Scottish independence would leave working people north and south of the border worse off, Ed Miliband claims.

item.title: Gun attack on house 'was hate crime'
item.description: A family of seven escape injury in a gun attack on a house in west Belfast in an incident being treated as a hate crime by police.

item.title: Further IT problems for Ulster Bank
item.description: Ulster Bank, a subsidiary of RBS, reports problems with its computer systems, as some customers are debited twice for cash machine withdrawals.

item.title: Miner ran for his life from pit
item.description: A miner working in a Swansea Valley mine on the day four men died when it flooded tells how he ran for his life.

item.title: Pupil school rape 'never happened'
item.description: A boy accused of raping a fellow pupil at a north Wales primary school tells a jury the alleged attack never happened.

item.title: South Sudan treason charges dropped
item.description: South Sudan withdraws charges against four top politicians accused of the alleged coup plot that triggered the civil war.

item.title: Kenyan officials wrangle over status
item.description: Kenyan MPs propose making it a criminal offence to address an official incorrectly, the latest move in a status struggle with newly created governors.

item.title: In pictures: Anzac Day
item.description: Images of Australians and New Zealanders around the world gathering on Anzac Day to remember those who fought and died for their countries, on the 99th anniversary of the Gallipoli landings.

item.title: Tokyo inflation rate at 22-year high
item.description: Tokyo consumer prices rise at their fastest pace in 22 years, surging 2.7% over a year, pointing to a likely increase in inflation across Japan.

item.title: Ecclestone denies bribery in Germany
item.description: Formula 1 boss Bernie Ecclestone denies charges of bribery at the start of his trial in Munich and says he will fight to clear his name.

item.title: Russia extends Navalny house arrest
item.description: A Moscow court extends the house arrest of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny by another six months for violating its conditions.

item.title: New clashes in Rio over dancer death
item.description: Brazilian police clash with resident of a slum in Rio, after the funeral of dancer who was shot by officers during unrest there on Tuesday.

item.title: Bolivia dismisses protesting troops
item.description: Bolivia's military chiefs have ordered the dismissal of more than 700 troops who have been protesting to demand better working conditions.

item.title: Netanyahu: Abbas must end Hamas pact
item.description: Israeli PM Netanyahu tells the BBC Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas must abandon his pact with Hamas if he wants peace talks to resume.

item.title: Iranians see petrol prices surge
item.description: Iran cuts state subsidies on petrol, sending prices up by as much as 75%, as the government tries to boost an economy battered by sanctions.

item.title: Plane stowaway 'going to Somalia'
item.description: The father of a US teenager who stowed away in a wheel well on a flight to Hawaii has said his son was unhappy at school and trying to return to Somalia.

item.title: US seeks e-cigarette restrictions
item.description: The US Food and Drug Administration is seeking minimum age restrictions and warnings on e-cigarettes because of uncertainties over their impact on health.

item.title: In pictures: Assault on Sloviansk
item.description: Operation against pro-Russian separatists

item.title: Day in pictures: 24 April 2014
item.description: News photos from past 24 hours: 24 April

item.title: Your pictures: Monuments
item.description: Readers' photos on the theme of "Monuments"

item.title: In pictures: Mumbai goes to vote
item.description: Sixth phase of the ongoing India elections

item.title: In pictures: divers search South Korea ferry
item.description: Divers search South Korea ferry

item.title: Day in pictures: 23 April 2014
item.description: News photos from past 24 hours: 23 April

item.title: In pictures: Rural murals
item.description: Huge murals in Dumfries and Galloway

item.title: In pictures: Garcia Marquez tributes
item.description: Memorials Nobel laureate Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: VIDEO: House of Commons
item.description: The PM is challenged over his support for Maria Miller following a row over her expenses.

item.title: VIDEO: Obama plays football with Asimo robot
item.description: President Obama plays football with a humanoid robot in Tokyo as part of his four-nation Asia tour.

item.title: VIDEO: William and Kate - tour highlights
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have spent the last two weeks touring Australia and New Zealand, but their tour is due to come to an end on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: Barricades burn after commando raid
item.description: The BBC's Oleg Boldyrev reports from the scene of an operation in eastern Ukraine where commandos cleared checkpoints that had been held by pro-Russian separatists.

item.title: VIDEO: Tattoo woman 'treated like criminal'
item.description: A British tourist arrested in Sri Lanka because she had a Buddha tattoo on her arm says she was treated "like a criminal" when she was held by the authorities.

item.title: VIDEO: Pensioner risks life on level crossing
item.description: CCTV footage has captured the moment a man in Czech Republic was hit by a speeding train - but walked away with only minor injuries.

item.title: VIDEO: Bernie Ecclestone denies bribery
item.description: Formula 1 boss Bernie Ecclestone has appeared in court at the start of a trial on bribery charges in Munich.

item.title: VIDEO: NYPD's Twitter campaign backfires
item.description: NYPD asked followers to tweet a photo of themselves with officers and add the hashtag "myNYPD" as part of a social media campaign.

item.title: VIDEO: Dhaka victims wait for compensation
item.description: Many survivors of the Rana Plaza factory collapse in Dhaka are still waiting for compensation after the tragedy in 2013 that killed 1,129 workers.

item.title: Prince George: Star of royal tour
item.description: Baby steals show as tour reveals rise in support for monarchy

item.title: Why is Kim Jong-un always surrounded by people taking notes?
item.description: Who are the people who take down Kim Jong-un's every word?

item.title: 'He couldn't believe he was lovable'
item.description: The story of one young man who 'couldn't believe he was lovable'

item.title: Quiz of the week's news
item.description: What made Poland's prime minister become an internet hit?

item.title: VIDEO: Testing glass to destruction
item.description: The lab that tests everyday products

item.title: Westminster without Scotland?
item.description: How a Scottish Yes vote would change the UK Parliament

item.title: How to mint your own virtual money
item.description: How easy is to coin your own virtual currency?

item.title: Food Photographer of the Year 2014
item.description: Are these the best food photographs of the past year?

item.title: Q&A: Ecclestone on trial - day one
item.description: The big questions from F1 chief's first day in Munich court

item.title: New mortgage rules and you
item.description: How home loan applicants could be asked about their lifestyle

item.title: Labour takes on zero-hours contracts
item.description: Ed Miliband pledges action, but will it help workers?
